author: bridge-bot
content: <Marcin> > <Marcin>  The double-signing impl still hasn't landed (needs a review) and still working on arkworks engine for it. Other than that, I don't think there are any outstanding features or issues, probably just bugfixes if any bugs are found (re @trent_vanepps: separately, are there any remaining tasks for finalizing the sequencer code? want to make sure we are tying up loose ends well in advance of the audit)

author: stefanbratanov
content: Have a question for the BLS method `bls.G1.is_in_prime_subgroup(P)` in the specs. I am using the blst library (https://github.com/supranational/blst) and there is a `blst.P1._in_group`. Is that the same method?

author: bridge-bot
content: <trent_vanepps> > <trent_vanepps>  thanks! who can i bother to give you a review for the double-signing work? (re @Marcin: The double-signing impl still hasn't landed (needs a review) and still working on arkworks engine for it. Other than that, I don't think there are any outstanding features or issues, probably just bugfixes if any bugs are found)

author: bridge-bot
content:
<CarlBeek> > <CarlBeek>  yes, that should be the same function. the BLST docs are crap so the only way to really know these things is to dig into their code yourself. üëç

As a side note Stefan, I'd love to get any feedback you have on the specs in terms of readability etc (re @kzg_ceremony_bot: <Stefan Bratanov> Have a question for the BLS method `bls.G1.is_in_prime_subgroup(P)` in the specs. I am using the blst library (https://github.com/supranational/blst) and there is a `blst.P1._in_group`. Is that the same method?)

author: stefanbratanov
content: Agree the BLST docs are crap. üòÑ As for the specs I find them good, they are very similar to the consensus-specs, so easy to follow. Hopefully I can release my implementation soon. üôÇ The signing and the API lifecycle is left.
